text: East Orange STEM Academy is a specialty magnet public school that serves students in sixth through twelfth grades in East Orange, in Essex County, New Jersey, United States, operating as part of the East Orange School District. The school focuses on the STEM fields, the academic disciplines of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. It helps to further the education of students in these fields. As of the 2018–19 school year, the school had an enrollment of 638 students and 48.7 classroom teachers (on an FTE basis), for a student–teacher ratio of 13.1:1. There were 306 students (48.0% of enrollment) eligible for free lunch and 35 (5.5% of students) eligible for reduced-cost lunch.School data for East Orange STEM Academy High School, National Center for Education Statistics. Accessed April 1, 2020. ==Administration== The principal is Dr. Vincent Stallings. His administrative team includes two assistant principals.Administrative Team, East Orange STEM Academy, East Orange School District.
